snippet: A Texas group that organizes competition among more than 200 private and parochial schools in the state has raised concerns over its dealings with non-Christian schools.
abstract: Texas Association of Private and Parochial Schools, a group that organizes competition among more than 200 private and parochial schools in the state, has raised concerns over its dealings with non-Christian schools; organization drew national attention when it refused to reschedule a state semifinal boys basketball game for an Orthodox Jewish day school, which could not play at the scheduled time because its players observe the Sabbath.
lead_paragraph: A Texas group that organizes competition among more than 200 private and parochial schools in the state has raised concerns over its dealings with non-Christian schools.
